page.title: 07RESULTS OF TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: Results analysis: There were several expected variations in traffic volumes,such as the early morning and late afternoon peak figures, the discrepancy between in-coming and out-going traffic during the "rush" hour, and low figures for taffic during the evening. Less predictable was the marginal difference in traffic between the two roads - quite clearly, the building of the Canterbury by-pass has considerably reduced volumes on the old A2. The A257 is a particularly congested route, however, especially considering the width of road and the number of minor feeder routes. Results of other supplementary surveys: The Canterbury-Littlebourne-Sandwich Road(A257) was found to be busier than the A2.
